page.title: 02The Landscape of Knockholt
page.content: This area is on the edge of the North Downs with the crest of the hills running diagonally from South West to North East. The scarp slope is steep and chalky with richer fields at its foot in the Darent valley. The dip slope faces North and is undulating with two deep dry valleys. It is covered with clay, with flints in the clay near the crest of the Downs.There is little surface water. Although the area is extensively farmed there are many woods and copses. A clump of trees on the crest of the Downs form the landmark of {Knockholt Beeches}which can be seen from many miles away, both North and South. There are distant views form the crest of the Downs - the hills beyond the Medway and the City of London and its tower blocks can be seen on a clear day.
